p: The recurrent aphthous stomatitis (RAS), commonly known as canker sore or aphthous ulcer (aphthae), affects approximately 20% of the general population in North America [ 1]. Gingivitis, generally referred to as gum disease is associated with bleeding that can lead to periodontal disease, which may destroy gum and bone, resulting in loss of tooth if left untreated [ 2]. Microbial plaque and persistent inflammation in periodontal pockets are significant risk factors for gingivitis and periodontal diseases [ 3]. Currently, chlorhexidine and metronidazole are being used as an adjunct to mechanical cleaning. However, the above treatments are likely to have adverse side effects.
